Class ec.e.file.EInputStream

Class ec.e.file.EInputStream 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.io.InputStream
           |
           +----ec.e.file.EInputStream
public class EInputStream
extends InputStream
An input stream based on the E file classes rather than the Java file classes. The idea is to emulate the function of the java InputStream class, but do so safely in the Vat environment. Thus we open from an E file object and hold onto the open stream with a tether.

available()
Return the number of bytes that can be read from this stream without blocking.
close()
Closes this stream and releases any system resources associated with it, by calling the stream's close method.
finalize()
Finalize by closing.
read()
Reads a byte of data from this stream, by calling the stream's read() method.
read(byte[])
Reads up to buf.length bytes of data from this stream into an array of bytes, by calling the stream's corresponding read(...) method.
read(byte[], int, int)
Reads up to length bytes of data from this stream into an array of bytes, by calling the stream's corresponding read(...) method.
skip(long)
Skips over and discards n bytes of data from the input stream, by calling the stream's corresponding skip() method.

Parameters:

the total number of bytes read into the buffer
Overrides:
read in class InputStream
skip 
  public long skip(long n) throws IOException
Skips over and discards n bytes of data from the input stream, by calling the stream's corresponding skip() method. The skip method may, for a variety of reasons, end up skipping over some smaller number of bytes, possibly zero. The actual number of bytes skipped is returned.
Parameters:
n - the number of bytes to be skipped.
Returns:
s the actual number of bytes skipped
Overrides:
skip in class InputStream
